content.div:
This week: Antiperspirants! Find out which ones left us fresh and stink-free and which ones will be banished to the bathroom waste-bin.



Secret Natural (Suggested Retail Price: $4.29. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“I used the Secret Natural Minerals Lemongrass Mint for 2 weeks. A great deodorant with a new smell – have never had mint before. Was expecting the scent to be masculine but it was simply fresh and clean. It was very easy to use and left no white marks, despite changing into tighter tank tops before working out. Speaking of working out, I’ve been wearing this deodorant at very hot sweaty spin class and I smell good all the way through. Packaging is nice and good amount of product for price. Will use again. Rating: 5/5.” - Cynthia Benaicha

“The scent of this product was pleasant and unique to anything I have tried before. After using the product the scent was gone of course but it kept me dry. There were no visible white marks left behind from this deodorant which was a huge relief. Was easy to use, easy on the wallet and I would buy this again in the future. Rating: 5/5.” -Robyn Kelly

“I really like the smell of the Secret Naturals – lemongrass and mint - scent. It wasn’t too strong and overpowering as some of the other Secrets products I’ve used in the past, but the scent also didn’t last much more than an hour into wearing it. It provided the same protection that a regular secret deodorant did (I didn’t sweat through it), and it also left the same powdery residue on my clothes that most other deodorants do too. It is far from invisible but that seems par for the course for most deodorants. The only shop stopper for me was that this deodorant left me with itchy/dried out armpits about 4 days into using it. I find Secret’s products are too strong for me and end up drying my skin out. I was hoping this would be different but it wasn’t the case. Sorry, Secret Naturals, you get a 2/5 from me.” - Catherine Gibson


Secret Scent Expressions (Suggested Retail Price: $4.99. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“There's not much difference between Secret's Scent Expressions and Naturals product line's performance. I tested the Lemongrass Mint which smelled like a light laundry detergent but not overly powerful - which is great if you're overly sensitive to perfumed products or work in a scent-free environment. It was long lasting and produced sweat free results! It's reasonably priced, easy to use but I would stick with Scent Expressions as it has a wider variety of fragrances. Rating: 4/5.” - Bonnie Large

“An already avid fan of Secret Scent Expressions (I really like their Coco Butter Kiss scent) I got adventurous and tried out a different aroma - Ooh La La Lavender. It's a nice and girly, flowery scent. I can get away with putting on this antiperspirant and not having to use an additional body spray/ perfume/ cologne as the scent lasts all day long. I didn't experience any underarm sweating even after a three-hour roller derby practice - the scent actually ramps up the more active you are. Even thought it's an 'invisible solid' it still left white marks on my shirts - but I've yet to find anything that is truly invisible. Reasonably priced and widely available, it's easy to use and comes in the yummiest scents I've ever used. I will definitely be wearing this again. Rating: 5/5.” - Bonnie Large

“My tested fragrance, ‘Ooh La La Lavender,’ was apparently more ‘Ooh La La’ than lavender. (There's little about this girly and soapy scent that reminds me of the actual flower.) Still, it's a fresh scent -- and the fragrance's persistence throughout the day is probably the lone remarkable thing about this product. As an antiperspirant, it's passable. (My underarms were dry; though they could've been dryer -- see Dry Idea -- and I smell as pretty as a perfumed princess.) Rating: 3/5.” --Leah Collins


Kiehl's Superbly Efficient Anti-Perspirant and Deodorant (Suggested Retail Price: $14.00. Available at Kiehl’s)

“When I first saw this product, I was very doubtful that a deodorant that goes on like a cream would offer any kind of protection. But I was proved wrong. It had a barely noticeable citrus smell, and absorbed very quickly. It didn’t leave any white residue at all, not even on my clothes when I put them on immediately after applying. I really like this product for summer because I found it dried much quicker and protected much better than the gel deodorants that I normally use when wearing sleeveless shirts and dresses. I didn’t find that it stopped me from sweating for long enough to use all day at work, but I’ll definitely keep it in rotation for going out on summer nights. Rating: 3/5.” - Stephanie Woods

“This deodorant was pretty awkward to put on because of its tube-like container that only allows a small amount out at a time. It had almost no scent, which was nice because I find a lot of deodorants to smell much too strong. It went on a bit wet, but quickly dried and left no residue. This product lasted throughout the day and caused no irritation. Normally I would recommend it, but the price of $14 makes me reconsider if the benefits are worth it. I think my regular dove deodorant will do just fine. Rating: 3.5/5.” – Jennifer Simone

“Kiehl's Deodorant Cream had me slightly stumped. Do you rub in on with your fingers? Use the top of the tube? And as I discovered, if you squirt out too much you're lotion-ing up your pits and it takes a while to dry! Once I got over this initial obstacle it was smooth sailing. The lotion is not heavily scented and it held up all day long and left my shirts sweat and stain free. Overall, Kiehl's works but I found the packaging and application to be awkward (especially if you want a mid-day refresh) and at a cost of $14 per tube, it's expensive if you don't need a clinical strength deodorant. Rating: 2/5.” - Bonnie Large


Dry Idea (Suggested Retail Price: $3.49. Available at drug stores.)

“As a lady, and one who spends most of the day in front of a computer no less, I ‘glow’ more than sweat. Still, I'll attest to Dry Idea keeping me less ‘glow-y’ than usual; my underarms remained completely powder-dry and powder-scented all day. My biggest concern with an antiperspirant, however, is what damage it'll do to my wardrobe, which tends to favour black and white. Unfortunately, Dry Idea didn't just leave me powder-dry, but my new blouse as well. My top was haunted by pesky, powdery ‘Ghost Pits’ just moments after application. Rating: 3/5” --Leah Collins

“This product claimed to offer 48 hour protection from odour and 24 hour protection from wetness. I never attempted to go 48 hours with only one application, but it did offer 24 hour protection, even after working out. I didn’t like that it was unscented – I prefer something with a little bit of a scent. And though it said it was hypoallergenic, I found that my underarms were a bit dry and itchy after a few days of use. I would use this product again for the gym and for days when I felt like extra protection is needed, but I think that it’s much too strong to use every day. 3/5.” - Stephanie Woods

“This product was a total fail for me. It glided on smoothly and felt moisturizing, but it offered little protection. By the end of the day I felt sweaty and worried that I smelled bad - and it wasn't even a stressful or active day. I'd hate to be depending on this product during a workout (you know, if I was actually the type of person who did that sort of thing.) Rating: 2/5.” - Jen McDonnell

“When it comes to antiperspirants, I don’t care how it smells, what it looks like, if it leaves chalky marks – no, my only requirement is that it makes me stop sweating all day. You’d think this wouldn’t be that big of a deal, but even antiperspirants that say ‘extra strength’ usually let me down. However, Dry Idea was amazing – it worked right away and I didn’t have any sweat marks under my arms at the end of the day. It does leave some white marks, but I can deal with that if it means I’m not sweating through my clothes. Rating: 4.5/5.” – Kat Angus


The Body Shop DeoDry Dry-Effect Deodorant Roll On (Suggested Retail Price: $5.00. Available at The Body Shop)

“I feel as though every time I review a Body Shop product, the best thing I can say about it is that it smells nice. The main problem with a Body Shop antiperspirant that smells nice is that when the product fails to, y’know, STOP ME FROM SWEATING is that my sweat stink will eventually cancel out any fancy fragrance the stuff had to begin with. Rating: 1/5.” – Kat Angus

“It's hard to find deodorant for women; antiperspirant is everywhere but they tend to be loaded with aluminum, which I've always found scary. So I was anxious to try this product, even though it's a roll on, which I'm not a fan of. As with other roll ons, this felt wet and sticky going on. Thankfully it dried quickly. The coverage was great - it kept me clean and dry all day. I'll definitely use this again. Rating: 4/5.” - Jen McDonnell

“I may be biased when it comes to roll-on deodorants, as I normally use sticks to avoid any feeling of wet armpits. This deodorant goes on very wet and takes a few minutes to dry, whereas the Kiehl’s only took a few seconds. This combined with the overwhelming smell of flowers made me put this back in my drawer and not reach for it again. Although it lasted throughout the day, in my opinion, the scent and feel are much more important factors. Rating: 2.5/5.” – Jennifer Simone
